p: Goutweed (or Bishopâ€™s weed) is a creeping, ornamental herbaceous perennial from Europe that can grow up to 1 m tall. It was reported as potentially invasive as early at 1859 [ 57], and is currently distributed in the northeast, northern Midwest, and northwest U.S. It reproduces vegetatively via rhizomes, and can spread aggressively once established. Where it becomes invasive, it can form dense patches that outcompete native vegetation and is difficult to remove once established [ 57]. Goutweed is listed as one of the most common invasive species for Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore.
